metadata.title: CVE-2021-23963 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
When sharing geolocation during an active WebRTC share, Firefox could havereset the webRTC sharing state in the user interface, leading to loss ofcontrol over the currently granted permission. This vulnerability affectsFirefox < 85.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-23963` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 85.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 85.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 85.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '85.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
